Package de.oth.blocklib.helper.camera

Class ViewFrustum

java.lang.Object
de.oth.blocklib.helper.camera.ViewFrustum
public class ViewFrustum
extends java.lang.Object
Defines the view frustum of a Camera. Used to determine if a Chunk is possibly visible, or if it doesn't need to be rendered anyway. Written under guidance from Lighthouse3d.com "http://www.lighthouse3d.com/tutorials/view-frustum-culling/geometric-approach-implementation/"
Author:
Tobias Mueller

  • Constructor Details

    • ViewFrustum

      public ViewFrustum()
      Creates a new ViewFrustum.

  • Method Details

    • updateCameraSettings

      public void updateCameraSettings​(float angle, float ratio, float nearPlane, float farPlane)
      Has to be called if the settings of the camera have changed, so that the Frustum can be adapted.
      Parameters:
      angle - the field of view of the camera.
      ratio - the aspect-ratio of the camera.
      nearPlane - the distance to the near plane.
      farPlane - the distance to the far plane.

    • updateFrustum

      public void updateFrustum​(Camera cam)
      Has to be called if the position or alignment of the camera have changed.
      Parameters:
      cam - the camera that is used.

    • chunkInFrustum

      public boolean chunkInFrustum​(ChunkIDObject chunkID)
      This method can be used to determine, if a Chunk is visible in the ViewFrustum of the camera.
      Parameters:
      chunkID - The ChunkIDObject of the Chunk that should be tested.
      Returns:
      true if the Chunk is at least partly inside of the ViewFrustum, else false.
